attributes.action: Call for a global moratorium on deforestation.
attributes.background: While high-tech carbon dioxide removal solutions are under development, the “natural technology” of forests is currently the only proven means of removing and storing atmospheric CO2 at a scale that can meaningfully contribute to achieving carbon balance.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.climateandlandusealliance.org/scientists-statement/

attributes.action: Change the current process when bringing complaints to the IOPC
attributes.background: The IOPC (formerly the IPCC) is responsible for overseeing complaints made against police forces in England and Wales. However, the current procedure allows Chief Constables to circumnavigate the IOPC and investigate complaints themselves. We want this changed to make the IOPC truly independent.
attributes.additional_details: When a complaint is made to the IOPC the current procedure is that it is sent to the Chief Constable of the force being complained about. It is then the decision of that Chief Constable whether he/she will investigate or hand it back to the IOPC. This current system is not independent or fair and means that in many cases the complainant is prevented by the police from being heard by anyone impartial unless they apply for a Judicial Review afterwards, which is beyond the financial means of most.

attributes.action: Allow ESA / UC claimants to only go a maximum of 4 weeks without payment.
attributes.background: Employment Support Allowance / Universal credit in many cases is there to provide financial help to those who are unable to work due to physical / mental health conditions. During considerations, assessments and appeals etc. payments can unfortunately be put on hold for long periods of time.
attributes.additional_details: The whole process causes a lot of unnecessary stress and financial strain to those affected. The time frame for this should be limited to 4 weeks maximum, as currently in many cases this can be ongoing for months when there is no need for it to take this long.

attributes.action: Review the unfair school fine system where 2 parent families pay twice
attributes.background: The penalty for taking a child out of school is on a per person, per child basis. This means two parent families have to pay the fine twice. This is unfair and should be reviewed.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all Police Officers to carry Taser by 2020
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for all Police Officers to carry a Taser gun by 2020 to protect Police Officers and the public.

attributes.action: Introduce a Free Speech Act and end hate speech laws in the UK
attributes.background: We should have a law protecting the right to free speech like the USA. It should also repeal laws on hate speech and prevent people being arrested for jokes or offending someone.

attributes.action: Provide more direct investment in nuclear new build projects in the U.K.
attributes.background:
In the last few months, two major developers have pulled out of plans to develop large scale new nuclear in the UK. 

In order to meet future electricity demand and reach climate change targets, no other low carbon technologies are available to replace reliable baseload electricity supply.
attributes.additional_details:
The two suspended projects would have produced 9.2GW of low carbon electricity to the national grid, avoiding millions of tonnes of CO2 emissions each year. At their peaks these projects would have also provided tens of thousands of jobs, a huge boost to the local economy. 

This World Nuclear Association presents the main benefits of nuclear power: http://www.world-nuclear.org/information-library/current-and-future-generation/world-energy-needs-and-nuclear-power.aspx

attributes.action: End Austerity and increase funding to NHS, Schools & Housing Authority
attributes.background: NHS workers have been overworked. They are tired, depressed, and most of all exhausted. NHS funding, quite simply, is totally inadequate. The same can be said about our Schools. Homelessness is the highest it has ever been.

attributes.action: The government should grant £61,000,000 to children’s charities.
attributes.background: Children in Need do fantastic work across the UK. The Government should match the funding made by public donation to double the money available to children’s charities.
attributes.additional_details: £61,000,000 is available this year and, additionally, further funds can be allocated via Gift Aid.

attributes.action: Ban plastic toothbrushes and replace with Eco/environmental friendly ones
attributes.background: The biggest causes of pollution are factories, the burning of fossil fuels and of course plastics but the list of causes continues, we need to stop using plastic so much and replace it with environmental/Eco friendly products.
attributes.additional_details: With the removal of plastic toothbrushes from our country will NOT become an issue, plastic can easily be replaced with wooden brushes that can be recycled, or even better options such as Eco-friendly toothbrushes. Plastic causes damage to the environment; animals are suffering from the constant dumping of plastic, another is that sewage-system gets clogged the plastic form clumps with other waste and blocks water running, beautiful landscapes and habitats are destroyed. It is an open and shut case.

attributes.action: Publicly reject Action on Sugar's call for a "milkshake ban"
attributes.background:
Action on Sugar, a British pressure group, has called for all milkshakes with more than 300 calories to be banned for health reasons. 

This is absurd, and would be a huge government overreach. Large, thick milkshakes are a tasty occasional treat, and virtually everyone treats them as such.
attributes.additional_details:
Action on Sugar is basing their wild demand for a ban based on the ridiculous assumption that these kinds of milkshakes would be "consumed on a daily basis", to quote their own chairman Graham McGregor.

The government should publicly state that they are not seriously considering this proposal. The obesity crisis is serious, but this is not the solution.

BBC report: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-46179175?SThisFB&fbclid=IwAR2_MwWYdlQU4p8SeoADkSdm40-8ajWkqgkqdzXQTKH0iXH0tz0U2qpM3a0

attributes.action: Ban Fireworks that are toxic to both the environment and humans!
attributes.background: To produce the oxygen needed for fireworks, many fireworks contain oxidisers known as perchlorates. These can dissolve in water, contaminating rivers, lakes and drinking water.
attributes.additional_details: "Fireworks get their flamboyance from a variety of chemicals, many of which are toxic to humans. From the gunpowder that fuels their flight to the metallic compounds that colour their explosions, fireworks often contain carcinogenic or hormone-disrupting substances that can seep into soil and water, not to mention the lung-clogging smoke they release and plastic debris they scatter."

attributes.action: Keep grants for plug-in hybrid & electric cars at their current levels or above
attributes.background: Sales of electric cars are starting to take off, but government action could stop it in its tracks. From 12 November onwards, the government will drop cash incentives even for the greenest plug-in hybrid cars. More seriously, the discount on full-electric vehicles will be cut from £4500 to £3500.
attributes.additional_details:
This action suggests the government doesn't care about the environment or encouraging adoption of low- and zero-emission vehicles. 

Nicholas Lyes from the RAC said the move was “a major blow to anyone hoping to go green with their next vehicle”. 

The AA's Jack Cousens: "This announcement will simply put more drivers off from buying greener cars."

More information 
Autocar -- https://www.autocar.co.uk/car-news/industry/mitsubishi-extremely-disappointed-end-government-plug-car-grants

BBC -- https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-45831150

Original announcement:
Gov.uk -- https://www.gov.uk/government/news/reformed-plug-in-car-grant-extended-into-next-decade

attributes.action: Require restaurants to give a range of vegan and vegetarian options by law
attributes.background: As it stands there is no actual law that states restaurants must provide vegan and vegetarian options. Veganism is on the rise and gaining real growth as its own lifestyle. most of us feel unfairly treated when our options are greatly limited and social interactions are in decline as a result
attributes.additional_details:
The other reasons are simple. While I firmly believe killing animals is wrong and that a plant based diet brings great benefits I accept not everyone will change. But I do believe that everyone is happy to try or at least take pressure away from the animal farming industry. 
The killing of animals for food and the use of what they provide has been linked to cancer, diabetes and other awful diseases by some studies. We pay millions in treating these.

attributes.action: Include an extra subject in the national curriculum about life skills.
attributes.background: We believe students in UK secondary schools should be given an extra subject including life skills and money management (e.g. how to pay bills, what benefits you’re entitled to, how to register to vote, how to write a CV, etc). This would equip students for adult life after education.

attributes.action: Ensure all schools offer reception children a full time education from September
attributes.background: Every September many schools accept reception children for only part of a day for up to 6 weeks, causing enormous difficulties for many parents. Working parents have to take leave, unpaid leave in the case of self-employed parents, or pay huge childcare costs while the phased start is in place
attributes.additional_details:
There is little awareness of a ruling by the Schools Adjudicator in 2013 who said, in reference to phased starts, “It is not permissible in my view for a school to deny a child a term of full-time education. The school has a duty to provide a full-time place from September and cannot refuse to do so.”

The latest school admissions code supports this, stating that a local authority must make clear that children are entitled to a full-time place in the Sept following their fourth birthday.

attributes.action: Allow adoption for adults over the age of 18 like in the USA
attributes.background: Adult adoption has been legal in most states of the USA since 2002. I am now 21 years of age and at an age where I feel I can make judgement on who MY father should be. The fact that I cannot be adopted my a man who has stood by me for years because I am “too old” is completely against my rights.
attributes.additional_details: I intend on getting the law changed so that myself and others can make this descision. Many people do it for different reasons. It should be a choice that can be made at any time in an adults life.

attributes.action: Let us vote on petitions
attributes.background:
Petitions with 200k signatures should be put to a public vote.
It is unjust & Unfair that Parliament make all the decisions & decide what issues we can/can't vote on, people should make policy, not just parliament, we need more democracy not less! 

Join the campaign @ Let Us Vote on Fb & Twitter
attributes.additional_details:
Our proposal: Applicable petitions would be voted on alongside general elections, if they passed the 200k threshold.

This would give people the power to bring change, It would get people involved, giving us the power to shape Government policy, with a new era of British democracy, where anyone can force change.

It would also stop the discontent for petitions we see now & allow the UK to join the list, of many countries where petitions can force a vote.

Join the campaign. Demand Democracy!

attributes.action: All public institutions must use toiletries that contain no animal ingredients.
attributes.background:
Ethical veganism is not limited to what is eaten, but to everything that is used; it is about minimising harm in all aspects of our lives.
It is reasonable for all public institutions to be mandated to use toiletries that contain no animal ingredients and that are not tested on animals.
attributes.additional_details:
The right to practice your religion and belief is covered under article 9 of the European Convention of Human Rights and the UK's Equality Act.

Under this legislation, the right to hold and practice the view of ethical veganism is recognised. For example: those who are in hospital, school or prison, have the right to request vegan food options. The logic here is the same, we have the right to have vegans options for the washing of our hands.

attributes.action: Fine people for leaving a dog tied up and unattended
attributes.background: Please make it illegal and fine those who leave dogs tied up and unattended.
attributes.additional_details:
Dogs who are left outside, tied up, unattended are at risk.
They are more likely to get stolen which is traumatic for the owner and a waste of police resources when so easily avoided. Most of these dogs are not reunited with their families. This should be the responsibility of the owner. Many are not aware dog theft is on the rise in UK by 25% in the last few years.
Additionally the owner may not be aware they made need to clean up after their dog if they have not seen it fouling the pavement.
It can also create issues amongst passing dogs if pavements and paths are blocked by another dog that is restrained. As well as those who are fearful of dogs but have no option to approach if the path is blocked by a dog.

attributes.action: Parliament Must reject the EU withdrawal agreement that is on the table.
attributes.background: This agreement is not fit for purpose it gives the EU everything they want but the UK must wait to see what it gets, and there is no way out.

attributes.action: Name one of Her Majesties warships HMS Walker
attributes.background: Captain Walker was a superb Captain in WW2 in anti submarine warfare and died aged 48 in 1944. He was a highly decorated officer who died from exhaustion and overwork in 1944, his son was killed onboard HMSubmarine Parthian in 1943.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederic_John_Walker

Walker sank more U-boats during the Battle of the Atlantic than any other British or Allied commander, and he was instrumental in the Allied victory of the Battle of the Atlantic.

attributes.action: The government should stop ALL foreign aid now!
attributes.background: Issues at home are more important.
attributes.additional_details:
Foreign aid is given to India and they have a space programme 
Foreign aid is given to Pakistan, where Christians have been persecuted
Money should be spent on the NHS, pensions, policing etc.

attributes.action: Reduce maximum stake Fixed Odds Betting Terminals from £100 to £2 by April 2019
attributes.background:
Chancellor Philip Hammond said in Monday's Budget that the in stakes from £100 to £2 would come into force in October 2019 not the agreed April 2019, this is totally unacceptable

The users of these machines are being sacrificed over Gambling Industry Profits.
attributes.additional_details:
"From the time of the announcement to reduce stakes and its implementation, over £1.6bn will be lost on these machines”

"In addition, two people will tragically take their lives every day due to gambling-related problems and, for that reason as much as any other, I believe this delay is unjustifiable." - Tracey Couch

Problem gamblers are often troubled, vulnerable and in self-destruct mode. An addict desires to burn quickly - the 'crack-cocaine' FOBT machines facilitate this B2 gaming/roulette can take £100 in seconds.

Please sign this petition to reduce the misery and risk of losing a loved one

attributes.action: Require sanctions for breaches of the Ministerial Code
attributes.background: Ministers breaking the ministerial code result in a report describing the breach - action may not be taken. The code should be given some force e.g. minor technical breach - an apology to Parliament: Deliberate major breach - a lifetime ban on being a Minister.
attributes.additional_details: In cases where it is found there has been a deliberate major breach, the individual, and any other who behaved similarly, could not be relied upon to abide by the code in future and would therefore be unfit to be a Minister. A right of appeal to a court should exist in the event of such a sanction.

attributes.action: Make nutrition a mandatory subject for children to learn in schools.
attributes.background: Making nutrition a mandatory subject in schools will help in the growing obesity rates in children and adults, this will lead to less of a strain on the NHS in the future.

attributes.action: Remove means testing from the student maintenance loan
attributes.background:
When applying for student finance the applicant needs to provide parental income. Based on the parental income the amount of maintenance loan available can be reduced to such an extent that it could limit the education opportunities of the student.

The current process penalises students.
attributes.additional_details:
The current process penalises students through no fault of their own and penalises where parents may have more income on paper.

The process does not take in consideration the number of siblings, the amount of disposable income, distance from home and is a blocker to University aspiration.

University drop out rates are also higher for stay at home students as opposed to those staying away. Students may be placed under pressure to stay at home due to family finance.

attributes.action: Make tobacco smoking banned in all public places
attributes.background: In a global environment increasingly polluted by emissions from motor vehicles and the air quality, especially in inner city urban environments becoming ever poorer, why do non-smokers have to put up with the disgusting habit of smoking in public places?

attributes.action: Ban discrimination in private rental sector towards people on benefits
attributes.background: It’s become increasingly difficult to find a letting agent/ landlord that will accept people on low incomes with top up benefits. The Government should have some input on this due to the lack of council properties available to those in need.
attributes.additional_details: I have been searching for a 2 bedroom property for myself and my daughter for a few months and the stumbling block is always the fact that I receive working/child tax credit and housing benefit. This in my opinion is discriminatory towards those on low incomes who need that extra help because they are not in a position to work full time.

attributes.action: Make the penalties for breaking election rules far stronger
attributes.background:
Vote Leave breaking electoral law in the referendum is the latest in a string of electoral scandals. 

The fines are so small as to be seen as a reasonable cost to parties and campaign groups. Penalties should include greater fines, prison and even annulment of results.

attributes.action: Change the law so the driver not the owner is responsible for a PCN
attributes.background:
My local council wrongly ticketed my company vehicle 
My company paid this fine and because the fine was paid the council closed the matter making impossible to appeal the ticket 
But my company then took this money from my wages leaving me out of pocket
attributes.additional_details:
On a non endorseable ticket it’s the owner not the driver that is liable 
However if you drive a company car your employer will more than likely pay the fine as ultimately they Will just deduct the money from this from your wages

attributes.action: All ‘fox’ hunts to be filmed by 3rd party, to ensure compliance with Hunting Act
attributes.background: Hunting of wild animals using dogs was made illegal in 2004, yet many continue to do it. Alternative hunts have been created in which dogs follow pre-placed scents, however many still attack wild animals. We believe the following further measures need to be taken:
attributes.additional_details:
- Dogs taking part in the hunt should be muzzled. They are only animals and do not know they should be following the pre-placed scent. It is the owners’ responsibility to ensure wild animals aren’t harmed.
- Hunts should be filmed. The whole hunt should be filmed, paid for by the organised hunt group, and the footage reviewed by a third party to make sure it is compliant with 2004 Hunting Act. Any illegal activity should be passed over to the police for prosecution.

attributes.action: Return old armed forces/emergency services pensions for those who signed for it.
attributes.background: All armed forces and emergency services personnel had their pensions reduced in 2015. I joined the armed forces and have lost many family while away thinking I knew what I’d get on retirement. The goal posts have been changed, I feel those sacrifices have been in vain. Re-instate original pensions.

attributes.action: Support Finance Bill Amendment to stop no-deal Brexit without Commons approval.
attributes.background: A cross-party group of MPs has tabled an amendment to the finance bill designed to stop the UK leaving the EU without a deal. The amendment would require: a Brexit deal; an extension of article 50; or a commons vote specifically approving a no deal Brexit - thus preventing no-deal without approval.
attributes.additional_details: Further information can be found:  https://www.theguardian.com/politics/live/2018/dec/20/brexit-latest-theresa-may-andrea-leadsom-makes-case-for-managed-no-deal-politics-live?page=with:block-5c1ba91de4b0cebe76178870#block-5c1ba91de4b0cebe76178870

attributes.action: Pass a new law on access to evidence so the wrongly convicted can get justice
attributes.background: Too often, police and prosecutors are failing to disclose crucial evidence, which means that innocent people end up in prison while the guilty walk free.
attributes.additional_details:
Yet under the current law, it is almost impossible for innocent prisoners to win back their freedom by accessing evidence wrongly withheld from them.
 
Disclosure failings are the biggest cause of miscarriages of justice. A former CPS head said potentially thousands of innocent people are languishing in our prisons due to failures to hand over evidence to the defence.
 
To ensure justice for wrongly convicted victims of disclosure failings, Parliament should pass a new law giving convicted defendants the right to access all non-sensitive material held by the police and CPS on their case and to instruct special counsel to inspect sensitive files.

attributes.action: Stop whilst in hospital exorbitant TV, phone and internet charges
attributes.background: We want the government to address the exorbitant prices that are taxed on ill people whilst in hospital, it is unacceptable for ill and terminally ill patient paying unrealistic charges for these services and then lining the pockets of companies based outside the UK

attributes.action: Require drivers to pass the UK driving test to be able to drive in the UK
attributes.background: The reason I believe that drivers from overseas should take the UK driving test is because there are too many accidents on the UK roads caused by drivers from overseas because the roads in the UK are different to many other countries.

attributes.action: Work with airlines and other countries to make all planes have disabled toilets
attributes.background: Why should disabled people only have short haul holidays and not drink on the flight? Surely this is discrimination. The UK Government must work with other countries to make airlines commit to making all planes accessible to disabled people.

attributes.action: Urge Saudi government to reduce pilgrimage fees
attributes.background: The British government should help British Muslims by passing the message to the Saudi government that British Muslims are not happy with the Umrah fee. Not every Muslim can’t afford to pay the extra fee
attributes.additional_details: Umrah is a spiritual journey for every Muslim all around the world, but for the last two years the Saudi government has made it harder for Muslims. It’s British parliament responsibility to raise our views with the Saudi government.

attributes.action: Make it law that savings interest rates go up same time as loans & mortgages.
attributes.background: This last decade's rock-bottom interest rates cost savers at least £100 billion in interest, because banks are quick to raise rates on loans & mortgages after BoE hikes, but are reluctant to offer the same, timely hikes for savings. Savers see this as immoral an highway robbery on our High Streets.
attributes.additional_details:
Before the 2008 crisis, from 1998 to 2007, savers earned £233 billion in interest. Following it, from 2008 to 2017, they earned just £129 billion because banks fail to pass on rate rises announced by the BoE.
Interest rates cost savers at least £100 billion in interest payments https://dailym.ai/2ot5PJ3 
Millions of savers are being hit by rip-off rates https://dailym.ai/2PzyEin
 
We request that our MP's debate this in Parliament and create a new law that will enforce timely equitable treatment for interest rates on savings and retrospectively make good the deficit.

attributes.action: Give students free dental care and prescriptions on the NHS
attributes.background: Most students do not have any income, or if they do it is very minimal. Most students cannot afford dental treatment or prescriptions and avoid going to the doctors or dentist. This can mean that medical problems can go untreated and thus cost the NHS more in the long term.

attributes.action: Change the UK voting system to a legal requirement to increase voting turnout
attributes.background: Making voting a legal requirement will increase the turnout, making more uk citizens happier with the results. Currently, only 60% of the registered voters take part, which leaves 40% unhappy with the turnout as that have not cast a vote. We would like to change this and make voting compulsory.

attributes.action: Parliament debate on the Right of Reply of people attacked in daily newspapers
attributes.background: It is intolerable and unfair that individuals attacked and criticised in the daily newspapers in the UK are not presently afforded the Right of Reply in said newspapers.
attributes.additional_details: I feel it is deemed necessary to debate whether individuals attacked in the UK mass media should be afforded an automatic Right of Reply to respond and the editors of the relevant newspapers should be made by law to publish those individuals replies with space afforded equal to the column size of the original articles which attacked them.

attributes.action: Make parental alienation a criminal offence
attributes.background: Parental alienation should be included in the definition of the offence of Controlling or Coercive Behaviour. The current offence doesn’t include control through children such as changing arrangements and no shows.

attributes.action: Ban escort review websites like UK Punting
attributes.background: On certain online escort review discussion boards, such as UK Punting, users submit aggressive & potentially defamatory posts about women. These websites ask for reviews to contain a link, contact details or address of the escort, which can put them at risk.
attributes.additional_details: The posts may contain unfounded accusations and fake reviews. Pictures of the escorts can be posted without consent. Such sites are dangerous to ALL women, not just sex workers. Appearing on them can lead to women being harassed, outed and having their addresses made public, which could result in criminal damage and burglary. Users can even post pictures of women in the street and give derogatory accounts of what they would like to do to them in locked sections of these forums.

attributes.action: Integrate Physical and Mental Health
attributes.background: It seems logical, but people can have both physical and mental health problems. Yet many mental health units do not allow for or accommodate physical health needs or disabilities. It's 2018, so surely we should be able to provide care for people with complex or multiple needs...
attributes.additional_details: I am detained in a mental health unit currently, and am often unable to take leave because I use a wheelchair and the hospital drive is too steep for a manual wheelchair. Many units are unable to accommodate wheelchair users at all, and those that do often struggle to provide equal access, consistent access to physio, or other adaptations. This may mean some young people, purely because of their physical health needs, are sent to elderly mental health wards! THIS NEEDS TO CHANGE!!!

attributes.action: Make it unlawful for social/news outlets to host any material of any child abuse
attributes.background: Failing to censor this material on platforms that are at so many peoples’ fingertips normalises this behaviour and perpetuates child abuse. Social and news medias have a responsibility to protect the vulnerable. These platforms must stop putting revenue before child safety by reporting and censoring
attributes.additional_details: Recent channel 4 Dispatches found that Facebook's moderators were not removing child physical abuse images from its platform, they merely place a warning on the images. Similarly, the mail online recently showed a graphic video of a mother beating her twins for profit. It is my belief that by leaving this kind of footage on media, whereby you needn’t seek it out, desensitises the public, normalises this behaviour and justifies mimicking. Any abuse of children should be taken as seriously as sex abuse

attributes.action: Enforce LGV's to the inside lane on major dual carriageway routes at PEAK times.
attributes.background:
Such as the A38 Birmingham to Derby & the A50 from Nottingham to Stoke. It is clear from travelling on the A14 where this was trailed and later enforced that it works.
This SAVES LIVES, emergency services resources & reduces insurance renewals (from fewer RTC's).

attributes.action: Make it a mandatory minimum age of 18 to join all social media platforms.
attributes.background:
Children under the age of 18 are exposed to adult content, videos of violence and sexual content on social media sites, some that have age requirements of 13 years to join.
This is damaging to society.
attributes.additional_details: Social media is being used as a tool to promote gang culture, knife crime and robbery and being openly available to view on apps like Snapchat, Facebook and Instagram. Young girls are exposed to sexual content and images that are digitally altered, which has a huge effect on mental health. 18 years old should be a minimum age to engage on these platforms.

attributes.action: Make sharps disposal bins free of charge to collect.
attributes.background: I am starting this petition to make the collection of sharps disposal bins free of charge.
attributes.additional_details: I'm starting this petition because I am a type 1 diabetic and I have to use a sharps disposal bin for my insulin cartridges, needles, blood test strips and my blood testing pen drums. Because this is a lot of sharps wastage i end up filling a sharps bin within a couple weeks.The collection of sharps bins used to be free of charge but now there not, you can only have 2 free collections per 12 months and any other collections after would be £5 each time, so I would end up spending £30 or even more per year because I have a lot of sharps wastage from my diabetic stuff. I find this very unfair for anyone who uses a sharps disposal bin as no one chooses to be ill and have to use sharps bin for their wastage and some people might not be able to afford it.
